description: Proactive technology development policies including increasing R&D investments, support for domestic semiconductor manufacturing, and enhancement of R&D capabilities in frontier technological fields such as AI and quantum computing; examples include US Acts pledging hundreds of billions of US dollars and the European Chips Act with more than 43 billion euros investment.
funding_amount: ['hundreds of billions in US dollars', 'more than 43 billion euros', '11 billion euros']

description: Hong Kong’s internationalisation of I&T talent is world-leading, with three local universities ranking top ten among the most international universities in the world, helping Hong Kong pool local and overseas talent and develop into an international I&T collaboration and exchange centre.
evidence_spans: ['The internationalisation of Hong Kong’s I&T talent is world-leading, with three of our local universities ranking top ten among the most international universities in the world14.', 'This, together with the international experiences accumulated and reputation and networks built over the years, will help Hong Kong pool local and overseas talent and develop into an international I&T collaboration and exchange centre.']

category: ['Innovation Talent Development', 'Industrial Modernization and New Industrialization', 'Innovation Ecosystem and Clusters', 'International Competition and Cooperation', 'Science and Technology Governance']
evidence_spans: ['Hong Kong must look squarely into different factors which may restrict I&T development and proactively address these challenges.', 'Inadequate efforts in attracting and retaining talent: Hong Kong is a small and externally-oriented economy with strong international connectivity and high talent mobility.', 'Hong Kong also lacks mature technology industry clusters.', 'the Government in the past lacked proactive and incentivising policies to attract and retain I&T talent.', 'Insufficient momentum to realise transformation of R&D outcomes: Owing to high land costs in Hong Kong, the business sector traditionally tends to invest in projects which can yield the biggest returns in the shortest time possible such as commercial/residential property developments.', 'the business sector has limited incentives to embark on technology-related ventures, in particular projects which necessitated substantial investments to establish R&D production bases but with a long payback periods.', 'universities with an array of upstream R&D inventions of core technologies, their existing management regimes are not flexible enough in dealing with IP matters and engaging staff for other external industry-based I&T activities.', 'Tight land supply and lengthy process of land development: Land supply in Hong Kong has been tight for years.', 'land designated for I&T purposes was limited in the past.', 'land development involves various statutory and administrative procedures and the process normally takes relatively longer time.', 'International competition become intensified and complicated: While the global competition in technology is intensifying, the complex and volatile international political and economic environment will inevitably affect I&T collaborations and exchanges among countries.']

policy_name: Hong Kong Innovation and Technology Development Blueprint
description: To develop Hong Kong into an international I&T centre by enhancing the local I&T ecosystem comprising universities, R&D institutes, enterprises and investors, and promoting a comprehensive I&T ecological chain encompassing upstream, midstream and downstream sectors to stimulate industry development and create a healthy cycle.
target_sector: technology industries and traditional manufacturing sector
evidence_spans: ['The Blueprint outlines the four broad development directions', 'To enhance the I&T ecosystem and promote interactive development of the upstream, midstream and downstream sectors', 'To develop Hong Kong into an international I&T centre, continuous enhancement of our local I&T ecosystem is essential.', 'The ecosystem comprises different stakeholders, including universities, R&D institutes, enterprises and investors, etc.', 'To create a vibrant I&T ecosystem and optimise the benefits brought by I&T to the society, Hong Kong needs to develop a comprehensive I&T ecological chain encompassing the upstream, midstream and downstream sectors.', 'Government facilitation measures will serve as a key impetus to drive and accelerate the active “1 to N” transformation of universities’ R&D outcomes.', 'Hong Kong should formulate an industry policy that suits its development needs.', 'It should support the development of technology industries with strategic significance and in which we enjoy clear advantages, so as to drive the robust development of our technology industry as a whole.', 'the Government should assist the traditional manufacturing sector in Hong Kong to upgrade and transform with the use of I&T to achieve smart production.', 'the Government should also promote the development of “new industrialisation”']
